Type and Incident: Unauthorized Access Points - Rogue Access Points Description: Unauthorized access points set up by attackers can compromise the network's security.
Resolution: Regularly scan for rogue access points using tools like wireless intrusion detection systems (WIDS), and employ strong access controls with WPA3 encryption.

Type and Incident: Unauthorized Access Points - Misconfigured Access Points Description: Access points with incorrect configurations can lead to security vulnerabilities.
Resolution: Implement a configuration management process, conduct regular security audits, and follow best practices for access point settings.

Type and Incident: Unauthorized Access Points - Insider Threats Description: Malicious actions by authorized personnel can pose serious threats to network security.
Resolution: Implement strict role-based access controls (RBAC), monitor user activities using security information and event management (SIEM) systems, and provide cybersecurity training to employees.

Type and Incident: Unauthorized Access Points - Weak Authentication Mechanisms Description: Inadequate authentication methods can lead to unauthorized access.
Resolution: Implement multi-factor authentication (MFA), strong password policies, and enforce regular password updates.

Type and Incident: Unauthorized Access Points - Credential Leakage Description: Storing credentials insecurely can result in their leakage and compromise.
Resolution: Use secure password management tools, encrypt stored credentials, and avoid hardcoding passwords in scripts or configuration files.

Type and Incident: Data Interception and Eavesdropping - Man-in-the-Middle Attacks Description: Attackers intercept and modify communications between two parties.
Resolution: Implement end-to-end encryption (E2EE) using protocols like HTTPS, SSH, and VPNs.

Type and Incident: Data Interception and Eavesdropping - Unencrypted Communication Description: Transmitting data in plain text exposes it to eavesdropping.
Resolution: Enforce encryption for sensitive data in transit using protocols like TLS/SSL.

Type and Incident: Data Interception and Eavesdropping - Weak Encryption Protocols Description: Outdated or weak encryption protocols can be exploited by attackers.
Resolution: Use the latest encryption algorithms and disable deprecated protocols like SSLv3.

Type and Incident: Data Interception and Eavesdropping - Insecure Wi-Fi Connections Description: Connecting to unsecured public Wi-Fi networks can expose sensitive data.
Resolution: Avoid using open Wi-Fi networks, employ VPNs for secure connections, and configure devices not to automatically connect to unknown networks.

Type and Incident: Data Interception and Eavesdropping - Sniffing Attacks Description: Attackers capture network traffic to gain sensitive information.
Resolution: Use intrusion detection and prevention systems (IDPS) to detect and block sniffing attempts, and segment network traffic to limit its scope.

Type and Incident: Denial of Service (DoS) Attacks - Distributed DoS Attacks Description: Multiple compromised systems overwhelm network resources.
Resolution: Implement traffic filtering and rate limiting, and use DoS protection services or appliances.

Type and Incident: Denial of Service (DoS) Attacks - Resource Exhaustion Description: Attackers consume network resources to disrupt services.
Resolution: Regularly monitor resource utilization, implement load balancing, and use firewalls to filter traffic.

Type and Incident: Denial of Service (DoS) Attacks - Amplification Attacks Description: Attackers use amplification techniques to increase the impact of their attacks.
Resolution: Disable unused services, filter traffic at network borders, and update and patch vulnerable services.

Type and Incident: Denial of Service (DoS) Attacks - Zero-Day Exploits Description: Attackers exploit vulnerabilities before they are patched.
Resolution: Keep systems and software up to date, apply patches promptly, and implement intrusion prevention systems.

Type and Incident: Denial of Service (DoS) Attacks - Botnet Attacks Description: Large networks of compromised devices are used to launch attacks.
Resolution: Regularly update and patch devices, use intrusion detection systems, and employ IP reputation filtering.
